title: JCB 2014 No. 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a massive wine, compressed in black fruit, tobacco and cigar box. It has a big-boned nature to its structure and a tight embrace of oak and tannin. It offers plenty of heat around the baked blackberry and currant character.

title: La Sala 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and cedar lead the nose. The firm palate delivers black-currant jam, clove and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Lapostolle 2015 Grand Selection Merlot (Rapel Valley)
description: A dark color and concentrated aromas of black cherry, cassis, licorice and even some charcoal are good indicators of what's coming—namely a dense palate with tartaric bite and ripe plum and blackberry flavors. A full finish with scratchy tannins tastes of chocolate and oak.

title: Lloyd 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cooked red cherries, sharp cranberries and butter pastries meet with a touch of campfire on the nose of this bottling. There's a tannic firmness to the palate, where sticky tannins carry flavors of tart red fruit and baking spice.

title: Marrenon 2015 Grande Toque Red (Luberon)
description: Blueberry and black-cherry flavors are unctuously ripe on this concentrated red, balanced neatly by a fiery dose of black pepper and a cool mineral undertone. Approachable and forward, it finishes with bold, slightly tacky tannins.

title: Notre Dame de Cousignac 2014 Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Hints of coffee beans, smoke and caramel entice on the nose of this opulent, fleshy red. Ripe raspberry and preserved-strawberry flavors are lip-smackingly forward yet nuanced by hints of animal and earth. Fine-grained tannins penetrate through a moderately long finish.

title: Pence Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very delicate on the nose, this bottling from Blair Pence offers light lemon, fresh nectarine and wet cement aromas. It's very tight and edgy on the sip, with lime flavors and a pinch of baking spice, proving crisp and refreshing.

title: Poggio al Sole 2014  Chianti Classico
description: Made with 90% Sangiovese, 5% Canaiolo and 5% Merlot, this has aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and a whiff of cedar. The savory palate delivers black cherry, sage and a hint of star anise alongside lithe tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Primus 2015 Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: This high level of good is about where Primus falls year after year. This vintage shows blackberry and spice aromas in front of a tannic, pulling palate. Dark black-fruit flavors are nonspecific, while this has tannic rub along with berry and oak flavors on the finish.

title: Tamarack Cellars 2013 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Reserve Red (Red Mountain)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up half of this blend, with the balance Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Merlot. The aromas bring wound-up notes of red apple, cherry, herb, graphite, flower and barrel spice. The flavors are smooth and silky in feel, showing a pleasing depth.

title: Undurraga 2013 T.H. Terroir Hunter Rarities Garnacha-Cariñena-Monastrell Red (Cauquenes Valley)
description: Ripe berry aromas include notes of cassis and raisin. Rarities is a good name for this, because there are few (if any) Grenache-Carignan-Monastrell blends being made in Chile besides this. Old vines and a cool year have combined to create an interesting wine with a medium body but bold acidity. Two years in oak has tamed some of the raciness, leaving sunbaked flavors offset by wiry acidity.

title: Victor Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Good balance, medium body and a nice blend of fruit and spice flavors make this wine taste very well put together. It has crisp apple and lemon aromas, deceptively concentrated nutmeg, fig and pear flavors that slowly unfold on the palate, and a good lingering finish.

title: Villa Calcinaia 2014 Vigna Bastignano  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with truffle, black-skinned berry and leather aromas. Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, the juicy, medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, cinnamon and black pepper while polished tannins give it balance and support. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Wente 2016 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's a classic California Chardonnay backbone to this bottling, with aromas of toasted wood, crème brûlée, poached pear and apple custard, yet there are also more delicate hints of chalk and orange blossom as well. The palate combines ripe Pink Lady apples and vanilla spice and caramel richness.

title: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Paradise Lane Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Eucalyptus, Bay leaf and mint figure in prominently to the nose of this wine, an herbaceous expression of the variety that's sinewy in thick blackberry, almost to a syrupy level. From head-trained older vines, it retains that mix of fruit and earth to the powerful end.

title: Winzer Krems 2015 Edition Chremisa Sandgrube 13 Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Fleshy and ripe red cherry fruit notes stream from the glass. The palate is equally fruit-driven in an abundance of juicy, almost overripe fruit. There is ample freshness to serve as a counterbalance. The finish has balance and crunchy cherry verve.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Zoto Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Reserve aromas of black cherry, plum, clove and tarragon-crusted roast pork show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines pomegranate and rhubarb with subtle star anise spice, proving altogether delicate and easy to drink.

title: Casa Marin 2011 Lo Abarca Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Antonio)
description: Despite having spent more than five years in bottle, this Pinot is maintaining a lightly spiced nose with freshness along with herbal plum and currant aromas. A fleshy, chewy palate is mature but still lively. Peppery plum and herbal flavors reflect a cool year, while woody oak notes and medicinal cherry and plum flavors wrap this up.

title: Botanica 2015 The Mary Delany Collection Pinot Noir (Western Cape)
description: This opens with bright red-cherry and strawberry aromas that are supported by a minty-mocha accent. The palate offers more herbal impression, in waves of fresh mint and licorice that sit atop the fruit core. Oodles of cocoa and woodspice unfold on the lush finish, with some lingering tannic grip and persistence. Drink now–2022.

title: Château Val Joanis 2015 Tradition Syrah (Luberon)
description: Blackberry and cherry flavors are pristine, almost crunchy, in this straightforward but concentrated Syrah. While brawny and ripe, it's balanced squarely by fresh acidity and savory edges of black pepper and bramble. The finish is tannic and firm.

title: Clos de la Brosse 2016  Saint-Amour
description: This four-acre walled vineyard is owned by the Lebeaupin family. The structure and density of the wine is the product of the old vines, bringing in tannins as well as ripe fruits. Age will soften the tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: Terre di Melazzano 2015 ChiAndré  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with organic Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Merlot grapes, this opens with aromas of red plum, baking spice and a touch of violet. The firm palate delivers tobacco, clove and black cherry alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Les Roches du Py  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: Produced from the domaine of Roches du Py that this producer purchased in 2004, this wine has much of the same structure and rich tannins as a true Côte du Py. The intense black fruits are poised and will allow the wine to age well. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine Romy 2016 Vieilles Vignes Les Pierres Dorées  (Beaujolais)
description: This family-owned estate, going back to 1700, lies in southern Beaujolais in the golden stones or Pierres Dorées region. The wine is rich and intense with black fruits and impressive texture for a simple Beaujolais. Drink the wine now.

title: Fattoria di Corsignano 2013 L'Imperatrice Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Toast, French oak, espresso and forest floor aromas lead the nose. The tight palate is assertively tannic, offering cassis, dried cherry, coconut and vanilla alongside astringent, close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

title: Gagliole 2015 Rubiolo  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this medium-bodied red has aromas suggesting underbrush, red plum and a whiff of tobacco leaf. The round palate offers black cherry, clove and a hint of thyme alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: HammerSky 2014 Extraction Special Selection Reserve Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Bright blackberry jam aromas meet with dusty earth, baked bricks and a hint of caramel on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with blueberry, cassis and baked licorice flavors, very lush and comforting, if a tad sweet.

title: Il Brunone 2012  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas of leather, underbrush and a touch of iris take shape on this 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo blend. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, raspberry jam and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2024.

title: Jules Taylor 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a soft and round Pinot with no sharp edges. Flower stalks mingle with almost confect cherry and watermelon notes on the nose, while the palate is plush and juicy with a satiny texture, a nice gentle grip of tannins and a raspberry tang to finish things off.

title: La Bioca 2014 Pistin  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of fennel, chopped herb and menthol lift out of the glass. The somewhat lean, racy palate offers dried cranberry, coffee bean and clove framed in firm tannins and vibrant acidity. A touch of licorice softens the tight finish.
